intro: Stemodia florulenta, commonly known as the showy stemodia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered with fine hairs. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
